Lol. Haircut at your own risk. Be careful out there
Thanks. FWIW, Sam just drove into work and said de-icing car takes a bit of time, but roads are fine
Woke up with the beginnings of a cold so was planning on WFH for at least the morning
Bummer. In my experience, taking oil of oregano at a start of a cold can help stop it in its tracks. <@U0XJFPSRL> do you have a pretty good backlog of take from which to work from the AM?
Backlog of take?
Tasks*
Gotcha. Yea, hoping to connect with Megan at podium stuff sometime today as well
rob: oil of oregano is one of the absolute worst tasting things i have ever tried in my life
yo, i’m wfh today also. not toying with the snow/sleet in the afternoon forecast. gonna check in with Jason to see where he’s left off and pick up from there
I flipped my car over in front of megan B’s so I’m just sitting here upside down
lol
:turtle:
:upside_down_face:
<@U026E0ZNR>: you on this today right?
yep
<@U0260V4K1>: I'll come getcha
<@U026E0ZNR> you have direction as to what to work on?
yes, direction is to be working on map styling today
cool <@U02F9CXTL> and you should talk directly
we have
is there anything else on the docket to know about?
we can cover off at stand up.  moreso an awareness thig that youre back in the fold
cool cool
<!channel> we are doing stand up fom courtyard.  if youre at home please use the gvc link in the meeting invite

Thanks again everyone! Quick follow-up on a few of the items we discussed today: • I scheduled an 11:45-12:00 jam session between <@U0XJFPSRL> and <@U0HP6TFNX> to discuss compiling a UX hit list • <@U02F9CXTL>, I know there was some back and forth on CMS look and feel, just following up with: what is your understanding of where we netted out on that discussion?
On the second bullet, <@U02F9CXTL> <@U0260V4K1> I can find some time between you guys and <@U2670DYLE>
so can I ask this: what’s the goal with the CMS look and feel? Are there specific things you’re seeing that need to be resolved before tuesday?
I just want to make sure trent and jason are driving towards something
<@U0B9N0HF0> I just talked to <@U2670DYLE> Ill have some feedback for him sat
- also - were did we end with the name of this?
where -
no name

Ok great! Thanks. As for goal, I hope it's not too simplistic to say: Put our best foot forward with the client and turn over something that feels considered and professional. I can certainly be more specific, but that's really what we are reaching for.
continuing our discussion from yesterday about how to represent stories on a map... I wanted to throw in a mention of the google analytics map interface as a reference
that content is similar to our content, in that it isn't pins, it's highlights of geographic areas
areas are highlighted when there's content
<@U0HP6TFNX|megan> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/megan/F4040HJUQ/pasted_image_at_2017_02_03_11_36_am.png|Pasted image at 2017-02-03, 11:36 AM>
thats a great point <@U0HP6TFNX>

<@U0HP6TFNX|megan> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/megan/F40QUG7T4/pasted_image_at_2017_02_03_11_38_am.png|Pasted image at 2017-02-03, 11:38 AM> and commented: when you drill down into state level, it switches to a different style to highlight data in cities

initial_comment.comment: when you drill down into state level, it switches to a different style to highlight data in cities

text: looks like they are using the geo chart
<@U0EL0GLEL> that's what we're using too, right?
Are we still meeting <@U0HP6TFNX>?
yep
yeah i added support for it, also support for regular maps api, either we want to use is fine

Megan and I chatted about updating the Net Contributor Podium Criteria to make sure it covers everything discussed in the site visit notes doc. We also set up a 2 hr work session on Monday to get through the podium wires. We are also spending time today thinking about/sketching the podium "player" that will control what is shown on the wall
Great to hear! Please try to protect that time as much as possible. I suggest maybe even going dark off Slack. Also, Dza is working to get Megan B. off your back Megan a bit.
Perhaps leaving your mobile in case something 911 comes up, but otherwise, removing the cognitive load that attending to Slack requires
and thank you!
thanks Dennis, I do think it's premature to try to write a case study. designing the experience has to come first. everything else in good time.
<@U0XJFPSRL> is there anything for Display Walls that needs UX treatment or is Design running with all layout?
Jason and Trent are rolling with that
ok cool thanks <@U0260V4K1> wasnt sure if the work was contingent upon UX docs.

so im having a disconnect in how the layout is dynamically chosen based on supplied data. The concept is fine. but if you take into account that there are 2 types of different data it breaks. If someone is building out a project and that is associated to an initiative, do they end up with a different layout than if there isnt an initiative? I would think so, what if that initative only has the title in it, and they are working on the project data, they would see a layout preview that shows accordingly. But then they go add the hero image, does this change the layout? Did that layout that they had seen before and were working with in mind just get changed out from under them? They are in a different area, they left the story editor where they thought the layout was set, and changing a value in initiative would cause this cascading change?
All good questions. Happy to hop on a gvc and talk deeper about this, but high level: yes, it would change from what they had seen
The thinking is 1) prioritizing the guest experience over the content creators. We don't want to have a bunch of dead space on the wall if we can help it
2) you're right that there aren't enough templates now to account for all (or even most) scenarios. We're just trying to balance against the time we have
3) and I could be wrong here, so someone correct me if I'm wrong: I think we're also mitigating both dead space and weird template brakes by requiring a certain level of content be entered

I think its fine, Im planning right now to pull up the template that best matches the data at runtime. If we think that its good enough that they might have seen the wrong template in their preview, that they likely wont remember anyways. or its close enough. Seems fair enough.

defining some templates is pretty trivial, I have a table that has the definitions of what that means in it, simple enough to define these layouts. How the data relates im not sure yet, I want to see the rules for how we think it should work first. Still dont think it will be too hard to do either way.
Cool. I'm honestly not too concerned about content creators. We're pushing towards getting all the rules defined, so hopefully soon
Sure it's just dramatic language :stuck_out_tongue: But plz keep in mind content creators are the primary stakeholders of this
aka who Allie is responsible to
of net contributor?
Yeah
uhhhh
Im going to disagree there
the guests visiting are the audience
they’re who this is for
Ok fair. Don't disagree that the guests are the primary user/audience. But content partners are the stake holders. They want this to show off what they are doing

They are the people that Allie is most concerned with. I would never disagree with the statement that the guests are the ultimate stakeholders, but it's important to keep in mind that content partners are stakeholders
and i think we are, but if we have to make compromises (and we do), I’m inclined to angle them towards the guest experience

For sure. And conversation is probably best in person. I imagine we have very little difference in opinion here, if any. Just thought I'd bubble it up, because I think the content partners experience is "part of the grade".
for sure. and honestly, I think we’re already giving them a really good experience that’s going to get better as go

Really if they see any layout and get the idea of what it is going to do they would likely not care if there was a nuanced change that occurs when data changes. I would expect they dont even notice if the layout changes after they add something
agreed
agreed and am glad we are having this dialog (though i wish we were all together and having it in persona, and warm and with :pizza: )

The three wall systems in the rig are online and available over VNC. User is 'showtime', password is 'sekret'.

Side panels: ucs-df-1.local 192.168.168.136
3-up: ucs-df-2.local 192.168.168.245
4-up: ucs-df-3.local 192.168.168.118

NOTES:
* VNC is started on the 3-up and 4-up via the command line since the system service isn't working. The side panel system starts VNC automatically via the (identical) system service. 
* The left-most system's screen config is whacky in xorg.conf, and I'm unable to save it all. So, if it gets rebooted, you'll need to open the NVidia config and re-configure it.

For testing? We're hoping to have it up on a test server and that URL shared at noon
My thought for testing was to use the Google Content Archetype sheet and the data they have already input as our test scenarios
Go through 1 or 2 examples. We'll see that it all outputs into the one sheet and logs into the dB. While doing this, we will also take general usability notes on things that we noticed

We can then catalog that feedback :slightly_smiling_face: (I've already made a spreadsheet <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1L22_CkwWnuefWfesuaPbOXF6dVXiTMUsBOe-I1UPVvQ/edit?usp=sharing>) and prioritize it
